article_text:
Sioux Falls, SD

Two Sioux Falls police officers shot a pit bull that investigators say was about to attack them near Burnside Park Saturday night.

According to police, the officers shot the pit bull twice. Animal control took to the dog to a vet for treatment.

The officers were responding to call about a man being attacked by his own pit bull inside the park. The man suffered a bite wound to his left thumb but he refused medical treatment.

Witnesses told police they had seen the pit bull's owner fighting with another man inside a car before the dog attacked. The owner told police he had been robbed.
